result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Patrick Paar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher Patrick Paar is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher Patrick Paar was found guilty of Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to 16CF174 and 17CF373.
Defendant to report to Probation today October 27, 2017.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.

  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

records.addlTxt:
CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Erica Ellenwood, DF ATTY: James H Krave, DF: Christopher Patrick Paar appeared.  Court  called.  Includes case 15CF568, 16CF174, 17CF95, 17CF192, 17CF373 & 17CF547.  There is an agreement.  State has complied with victim rights.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to Ct 2 & Ct. 3 17CF373.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 2 & Ct. 3 in 17CF373. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct Ct. 1, Ct. 4 & Ct. 5 in 17CF373 and dismisses 17CF95, 17CF192 & 17CF547. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

Ct. 1 in 15CF568 & Ct. 3 & Ct 4 in 16CF174 & Ct. 2 & Ct. 3 in 17CF373 to all run concurrent to each other
- S/W 3 years probation with conditions
- 9 months conditional jail time with no credit for time served
- DE's sentence to beging 60 days from todays date
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. If UA testing is required, the same shall be viewed in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex. Additional testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.
- AODA and follow through with any recommended therapy or treatment
- DE to receive a Domestic Voilence Evaluation  
- DE to have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Tammy Paar.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent. 
- Court costs of $268.00 and $250.00 for the DNA Surcharge all other costs are suspended by the court and court waives the remaining DNA surcharges apply money on file
- DE to report to the St. Croix County Jail to provide a DNA Sample
- DE to sign up for probation today and all bail bonds to remain in effect until the DE signs up and then the bail bonds are vacated
- 20 days to appeal
To EJL from Agent Anderson re: PSI. Reviewed by EJL. OK. hml
Supplemental - EJL signed 9/25/17. E: DOC. eif
Sentencing hearing on October 27, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Erica Ellenwood, DF ATTY: James H Krave, DF: Christopher Patrick Paar appeared. UA testing results to be forwarded to the DA's office.  Court proceeds with the SEH on 15CF568 & 16CF174.  Attorneys argue time served.  Court will grants 29 days credit for time served.  State makes recommendation.  Tammy Paar makes recommendation.  Attorney Krave makes argument regarding the PSI.  Court orders a Supplemental PSI. Bails are continued.  Court adjourned.  lw  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA:  Erica Ellenwood, DF ATTY: James H Krave, DF: Christopher Patrick Paar appeared.  Court called.  Set for FPT.  There is an agreement.  Includes case 15CF568, 15CM657, 16CF147, 16CF174 & 16CF213.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads No Contest to Ct 1 in 15CF568 & DE pleads Guilty to Ct. 3 & Ct. 4 with the domestic abuse enhancer in 16CF174.   Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1 in 15CF568 & Ct. 3 & Ct. 4 with the domestic abuse enhancer in 16CF174. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt dismisses Ct 2 & Ct 3 in 15CF568 & Ct. 1 & Ct. 2 in 16CF174 & 15CM657, 16CF147, 16CF213. Court orders a PSI.  SEH will be scheduled after the Court and attorneys review the PSI.  Court adjourned.  lw

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Evenson, ADA: Erica Ellenwood DF ATTY: James H Krave DF: Christopher Patrick Paar appeared. Case called at 9:20. Includes 15CF568, 15CM657, 16CF147, 16CF174, 16CF213. ADA Ellenwood updates the court they do not have an agreement as of yet. ADA Ellenwood would like to set 15CF568 set for trial. Atty. Krave responds. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 19, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Final pre-trial on December 27, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial on December 2, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

*AMENDED INCLUDES CASE 15CF568,  15CM657,  16CF147,  16CF174 & 16CF213

- DE to reside in a location consistant with the CHIPS order

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- Random testing

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

 -It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Tammy Paar.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Megan E. Kelly, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea in court for James H Krave, DF:  Christopher Patrick Paar appeared from jail.  Court called at 9:20 a.m.  Includes case 15CF568, 15CM657, 16CF147, 16CF174 (STC) & 16CF213 (preliminary hearing).  Court proceeds with the preliminary hearing on 16CF213.  DE is waiving his right to a preliminary hearing.  DE files with the court the Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver.   Court questions the DE.  Court finds that the DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives right to a preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and that the DE probably committed one and binds the DE over for trial.  Attorney Andrea argues bond.  Court modifies the bond in all files to take effect on 06//09/16.   Court adjourned.  lw  Status conference scheduled for June 13, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Court finds probable cause that a felony was probably committed and probable cause that the DE probably committed one and binds the DE over for trial.  Court adjourned.  lw  Status conference scheduled for June 7, 2016 at 09:15 am.
